body.name: BLACK+DECKER 6-Slice Crisp 'N Bake Air Fry Toaster Oven, TO3215SS, 5 Cooking Functions, 60 Minute Timer, Stainless Steel

features: Air Fry Technology - Deep fried taste without the fat. This innovative cooking method surrounds food with high intensity hot air to bake, brown, and crisp your favorite foods using little to no oil.
5 Cooking Functions - Choose from five available cooking methods: bake, broil, toast, keep warm, and air fry.
Large Capacity - This large capacity toaster oven fits 6 slices of bread or a 12” pizza.
60-minute Timer - The 60-minute precision timer features stay-on functionality for long baking tasks.
Countertop Baking - The Bake function lets you make pizzas, frozen snacks, and so much more. It’s great for reheating leftovers without turning on the big oven.
body.description: Introducing Air Fry Technology, new in the BLACK+DECKER Crisp 'N Bake Air Fry Toaster Oven. This is deep fried taste without the fat! Air Fry Technology uses high intensity hot air to bake, brown, and crisp your favorite fried foods with little to no oil. Try French fries, veggie chips, breaded fish filets, frozen snacks, and a lot more! There’s space for up to six slices of bread or a 12” pizza. Three control knobs make it easy to set the toast timer and 60-minute timer, and choose from five cooking functions: bake, broil, toast, keep warm, and air fry. Convection technology circulates air within the oven for fast and even results when air frying. Plus, this toaster oven includes an air fry basket, bake/broil pan and rack, and an external crumb tray that slides in and out to make cleanup a breeze.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Air Fry Technology Deep fried taste without the fat! This innovative cooking method surrounds food with high intensity hot air to bake, brown, and crisp your favorite foods using little to no oil. 5 Cooking Functions Choose from five available cooking methods: bake, broil, toast, keep warm, and air fry. Countertop Baking The Bake function lets you make pizzas, frozen snacks, and so much more! It’s great for reheating leftovers without turning on the big oven. Large Capacity This large capacity toaster oven fits 6 slices of bread or a 12” pizza.

60-minute Timer The 60-minute precision timer features stay-on functionality for long baking tasks. Accessories Included Don’t worry about finding pans to fit in the oven. The included air fry basket, bake/broil rack and pan fit perfectly, making it easy to insert and remove food. External Crumb Tray The external crumb tray makes it easy to remove crumbs before they burn in the bottom of the oven. Easy-view Glass Door Keep an eye on food during cooking. The durable glass window gives you a clear view of food throughout the cooking process.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Perfect and simple controls. No digital learning curve, unlike other products. Love how it toasts bread so perfectly. And the air fry setting is awesome!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I thought it was bigger but honestly it's the perfect size..we can cook chicken for 2-3 people and perfect for bacon in the morning!Great quality and very quiet!Love it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Simple to use Toaster Oven and Air Fryer
reviews.reviewText: This toaster oven and air fryer works well and is simple to operate. Has four function- Air Fry, Bake Broil and Toast. All functions work. Good size Does not appear to Air fry food as quickly as other models but works. Poor instructions and the function buttons are small and hard to read. Reasonable price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars TIMER STOPPED WORKING! UPDATE!
reviews.reviewText: I have had B&D toaster ovens in the past. They worked competently. After three months this timer stopped working. What good is it!Update: I called Black and Decker. The young lady who answered the phone was EXCELLENT. (Please forgive me that I do not recall your name.) She was quick and knowledgeable. The next day I got a tracking number for the new replacement they were sending me. I have received it and using it in less than week.I must say that there are many other companies out there that should take a page out of B&D's book on customer service. Black and Decker's response wall all-around EXCELLENT. Thank you!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Very good quality. Cooks everything perfectly (if that’s possible.) Air fryer works great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The only reason we bought this toaster is it is manufactured without the use of PFAS. Otherwise it is a basic cheap toaster. It’s not an air fryer as claimed. No convect bake and its toaster ability is marginal.Does not toast evenly. Warms up cold pizza pretty well. You get what you pay for. It’ll do until more toasters are available without “forever chemicals”

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works, easy to use
reviews.reviewText: Gets very hot on top, I use top as a warmer when turned off.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Purchased January 31 2024. I think I unpacked this on the 5th of February.February 7 2024- Temperature control is what just killed and burned my brownies.When I first checked the temp just out of the box. I set the dial to 350. According to my oven thermometer (new) it only heated to 325 degrees. I could deal with that.Last night baked two potatoes, they came out a little dry.This morning I tried to bake a batch of brownies. set the temp to 325 (according to my oven thermometer). 15 minutes into the bake time, I smelled brownies burning. I pulled the pan out of the oven, and the top is burned! I left the oven open to cool it down. Turned the oven back on after it had cooled. It struggled to to get to 300 degrees, eventually it got back to 325 degrees. Currently I am trying to get my brownies cooked, and my house smells like burned brownies.Temperature control is the problem. I now have smoking brownies.Now I can not trust this oven to cook my food competently.I am so disappointed.I am sending this back!Another thing. This oven has the shortest cord ever! Where is it supposed to reach? I am glad I have an outlet it can reach. For anyone else, good luck!Feb 8 2024- I decided to give this a second try. This time to cook 2 sausages. I turned on the oven to 350 (what ever it thinks 350 is) 10 minutes later it was at 250 degrees, another 10 minutes later it got to 325degrees. After a whole 30 minutes the sausages are not cooked, and it is trying to burn the tops of them.I'm done with this. Now I don't know what to trust.
